Name: Kohl jar
Description: Small vessel of Egyptian alabaster designed to contain the classic black lead eye pigment of the ancient Egyptians (Arabic kohl), traces of which appear in the interior. The rim and separate flat lid are lost. The form is typical of the kohl containers in use during the Middle Kingdom. This example comes from the rich cemetery near modern Hu, ancient Hut-sekhem, regional capital for the seventh province of Upper Egypt.
